article.headline: Elon 67, Samford 54
article.story: ELON, N.C. -- Drew Spradlin scored 26 points as Elon beat Samford 67-54 Saturday in a Southern Conference game. It was the Phoenix's first win against Samford in five tries. Elon (7-8, 1-3) had to survive 32.7-percent shooting (16 of 49) to do it, but corralled many of its missed shots as it built a 44-25 advantage in rebounds, including 15 on the offensive boards. Spradlin, Elon's lone scorer in double figures, made 11 of 14 free throws as the Phoenix exploited their advantage in trips to the line. Elon made 27 of 34 free throws, compared to Samford's 12 of 14. The Phoenix did the bulk of their damage in the first half, when they raced to a 20-point lead before settling on a 38-20 advantage at intermission. Samford (10-6, 2-2) led once, on Jeffrey Merritt's jumper 95 seconds into the game. Drew Windler led Samford with 13 points and Josh Davis added 10.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
